div.head: Salt for melting
div.ab: Mix saltpeter & common salt, and melt them together, & cast on melted copper or ch in a bath, & it purifies & makes it run marvellously. First, one ought to decrepitate the common salt, that is to say holding it over a good fire until it no longer crackles or, to melt it better, in a four Ã vent. And cast it neatly on marble, then pestle it & grind it very finely, then put it in a crucible on as much saltpeter & let it boil, & mix them together until

the crucible will be red. Next, cast it on marble, and you will have a substance white, hard & even, like alabaster, with which you will be able to cast medals which will resemble marble, but keep them out of the humidity.
